Recent interventions in the currency spot market and festive season demand caused liquidity to briefly turn negative. The RBI plans to use measures like variable rate reverse repo auctions to maintain liquidity.

items.summary: Mule accounts are spreading across India beyond traditional hotspots. Criminals are using new locations and methods like in-game purchases to launder money. items.title: CBDT updates Capital Gains scheme, expands SEZ benefits

The amendment, effective November 19, extends the scheme to capital gains from shifting industrial units to SEZs under Section 54GA, encouraging such relocations by enabling tax exemptions.

items.title: Steel Ministry eases imports, extends quality control order exemption
items.summary: The Centre has relaxed several steel import rules to simplify compliance and support smaller businesses. The steel ministry has launched the SARAL Steel Import Monitoring System, which reduces the number of required data fields from 56 to 20 and allows a single registration number for up to 100 consignments a year, each capped at 10 tonnes.

items.title: DGCA to meet operators, pilots bodies over crew duty, rest norms next week
items.summary: The DGCA is meeting with airline operators and pilots next week. The discussion will focus on cockpit crew duty and rest rules. Pilots' bodies have raised concerns about these changes potentially favoring commercial interests over safety. The meeting will also address fatigue risk management systems.

items.title: OTT craze grows, but film lovers can't stay away from theatres

In comparison, those watching films solely in theatres and not having any access to a streaming platform service is 76 million, indicating limited impact of the increasing consumption of content on streaming platforms on theatre footfalls.

items.summary: In October, India's core sector stagnated, marking its lowest growth rate in over a year. The mining and electricity sectors took a notable hit, particularly with coal production plummeting. Additionally, there were drops in natural gas and crude oil outputs.

items.title: Indian exports to continue strong show in H2 FY26: Commerce Ministry
items.summary: India's exports are set for a strong showing in the rest of FY26. The first half of the fiscal year saw record quarterly exports. This momentum, combined with ongoing government support for exporters, points to continued success. India's total exports for the first half of FY26 reached $418.9 billion, a significant increase from the previous year.

items.title: Moody's pegs India's growth at 7% in 2025, 6.4% in 2026
items.summary: India is set to lead economic growth in the Asia-Pacific region, excluding Greater China. Moody's Ratings projects India's GDP to grow by 7% in 2025. Strong domestic demand will support this growth amid global uncertainty. India and Australia will spearhead growth in their respective market categories. Emerging markets will drive regional GDP expansion.

items.title: Good trade deal with US will ease pressure on our current account: RBI Guv Sanjay Malhotra
items.summary: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra is optimistic about a beneficial trade agreement with the United States. This deal is anticipated to reduce pressure on India's current account. The Governor also stated the central bank does not target specific exchange rates. India's foreign exchange reserves remain robust. The nation is also making progress in bilateral trade negotiations.

items.title: ‘Less hair, same love’: Satya Nadella reacts to his 32-year-old Microsoft Excel demo going viral
items.summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella reminisced about his 1993 Excel presentation, expressing his continued love for the software since its 1985 launch. The techie responded to a viral video of him from 1993 demonstrating how to transfer data from IBM Mainframe to Excel.

items.title: Govt plans maiden public InvIT to expand investor base for highways
items.summary: In a major step toward strengthening road asset monetization and expanding investment opportunities in the development of National Highway infrastructure, NHAI is in the process of establishing Raajmarg Infra Investment Trust as a public InvIT.

items.title: TRAI lobs an ad-cap googly just as TV broadcasters struggle with falling ads
items.summary: TRAI has issued show cause notices to major TV broadcasters for exceeding the 12-minute advertising cap per clock hour, reigniting a decade-long dispute. Broadcasters have 15 days to respond, while TRAI seeks to vacate an interim stay granted by the Delhi High Court. This action coincides with a drop in TV ad volumes and broadcaster revenues.

items.title: M&M charts decade of expansion plan with auto at core
items.summary: Mahindra Group has announced a ten-year expansion strategy. The automotive division will lead this growth, with a focus on SUVs and light commercial vehicles. Other businesses like farm equipment, financial services, and technology will also see significant expansion. The group aims for disciplined capital allocation and operating efficiency to achieve sustainable returns across its diverse portfolio.

items.title: Outdated approach behind outlandish consumer stock valuations: Kotak
IndianOil commences first-ever export of LNG to Nepal, informs Petroleum Minister Hardeep Puri
items.summary: This is the first consignment of a five-year deal between IndianOil and Nepal’s Yogya Holding agreed during the India Energy Week in February this year.

items.title: TPG agrees to invest $1 billion in TCS’s AI data center business HyperVault

items.summary: India’s foodgrain output touched a new high of 357.73 million tonnes in 2024-25, up 8% from 332.29 million tonnes a year earlier, government data showed. Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said the rise reflects farmers’ efforts and supportive policies such as higher MSP and procurement.

items.title: Reliance stops importing Russian crude for refinery operations
items.summary: Reliance Industries said it has stopped processing Russian crude at its Jamnagar SEZ refinery from 20 November, moving fully to non-Russian crude for all product exports starting 1 December. The company said the shift was completed ahead of schedule to meet product-import restrictions that take effect on 21 January 2026.

items.title: Revamped inland waterways to power Northeast’s growth, boost petroleum exports: Union minister Sarbananda Sonowal
items.summary: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal highlighted the rapid modernization of India's inland waterways, especially in the Northeast, unlocking economic opportunities and strengthening petroleum supply chains. This development is crucial for cross-border trade with Bangladesh and Southeast Asia, positioning the region as a vital energy transportation backbone.

items.title: Soon, you can have pure water from Russia's Caucasus Mountains in India
items.summary: Russian mineral water is set to debut in India by year-end with the launch of Gorji Vita, a new brand from Aqua Holding Company. The first shipment has been dispatched, targeting India's rapidly growing premium bottled water market, which is projected for significant expansion.

items.title: Marriott debuts Series by Marriott brand in India with 26 hotels

items.title: Govt extends exemption from quality norms compliance for certain steel, stainless steel grades until March

items.title: As US sanctions on Russian oil loom, India prepares to end its crude buying spree
items.summary: India's significant purchases of Russian oil are concluding. Last supertankers are en route before U.S. sanctions take effect. This marks a shift after three years of buying discounted Russian crude. Indian companies are preparing to comply with new rules to avoid penalties. Nayara Energy's situation remains complex due to its ownership structure.

items.title: PVR to add 100 screens in FY26, looking at tier III markets with affordable ticket pricing
items.summary: PVR INOX plans to add 100 screens this fiscal, with around 60 already opened and the remaining to come up by March, Executive Director Sanjeev Kumar Bijli said. The company may shut 10–15 underperforming screens this year, after closing about 55–60 last fiscal.

items.summary: Reliance Industries has ceased importing Russian oil for its export-only refinery from November 20. Exports from this facility will exclusively use non-Russian oil starting December 1. This move aligns with Government of India guidelines. Reliance, a major buyer of Russian crude, is recalibrating its imports. The company operates the world's largest refining complex in Jamnagar.
